title: Risk Assessment Model
description: A comprehensive risk assessment model for evaluating investment portfolios. This project documents the entire process from data collection through model validation, including methodology, assumptions, and results analysis.
short_description: Comprehensive risk assessment model for investment portfolio evaluation.
journal_content:
## Overview

This project involved developing a comprehensive risk assessment model for evaluating investment portfolios across multiple asset classes.

## Methodology

We employed a combination of Value at Risk (VaR) calculations, Monte Carlo simulations, and stress testing scenarios to evaluate portfolio risk.

## Key Findings

- Diversification across 5+ asset classes reduced portfolio volatility by 23%
- Tail risk was significantly underestimated by traditional VaR models
- Dynamic rebalancing strategies outperformed static allocations by 4.2% annually

## Tools Used

Python, NumPy, Pandas, SciPy for statistical modeling. Matplotlib and Plotly for visualization.

## Conclusion

The model demonstrated that incorporating regime-switching dynamics into risk assessment provides more accurate predictions during market stress periods.

title: Algorithmic Trading Strategy
description: Development and backtesting of a momentum-based algorithmic trading strategy. This journal-style write-up covers the research process, strategy design, implementation, and performance evaluation.
short_description: Momentum-based algorithmic trading strategy with backtesting results.
journal_content:
## Project Background

This project explores the development of a momentum-based algorithmic trading strategy for mid-cap equities.

## Strategy Design

The strategy uses a dual-momentum approach combining relative and absolute momentum signals with a 12-month lookback period.

## Implementation

Built using Python with the Zipline backtesting framework. The strategy was tested across 15 years of historical data.

## Results

- Annual return: 14.3% vs 9.8% benchmark
- Sharpe ratio: 1.42
- Maximum drawdown: -18.7%
- Win rate: 58%

## Lessons Learned

Transaction costs and slippage significantly impact real-world performance. The strategy performs best in trending markets and underperforms during range-bound periods.
